meanings.english_definition: (Japanese: きぼう) A feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen; a wish or dream.

examples.sentence: 彼は将来に大きな希望を持っている。(Kare wa shourai ni ookina kibou o motte iru.)
examples.translation: He has great hope for the future.
examples.english_translation: He has great hope for the future.

examples.sentence: 彼女の希望は世界平和だ。(Kanojo no kibou wa sekai heiwa da.)
希望を捨てるな！(Kibou o suteru na!)

collocations: 希望を持つ (kibou o motsu) - to have hope
希望に満ちる (kibou ni michiru) - to be full of hope
希望を捨てる (kibou o suteru) - to give up hope
希望を与える (kibou o ataeru) - to give hope
希望の光 (kibou no hikari) - a ray of hope
希望的観測 (kibouteki kansoku) - wishful thinking

meanings.definition: (Japanese: きぼう) The Japanese Experiment Module (JEM) of the International Space Station.
meanings.english_definition: The Japan Experiment Module (JEM), nicknamed "Kibo" (meaning "Hope" in Japanese), is a Japanese science module for the International Space Station (ISS).

examples.sentence: きぼうは国際宇宙ステーションに取り付けられている。(Kibou wa kokusai uchuusuteeshon ni toritsukerareteiru.)
examples.translation: Kibo is attached to the International Space Station.
examples.english_translation: Kibo is attached to the International Space Station.

examples.sentence: 宇宙飛行士はきぼうの中で実験を行う。(Uchuuhikoushi wa kibou no naka de jikken o okonau.)

collocations: 国際宇宙ステーション (kokusai uchuusuteeshon) - International Space Station

etymology.value: From Japanese 希望 (kibō), meaning "hope" or "aspiration".

inflection.notes: It is a noun, so it doesn't inflect.

usage_notes.explanation: The word "Kibo" has two main meanings. The first and most common meaning is "hope". The second meaning refers to the Japanese Experiment Module (JEM) on the International Space Station, which was named "Kibo" to symbolize hope for the future of space exploration. When used in the context of space, it is generally capitalized.

examples.incorrect: I have a kibo to become a doctor.
examples.correct: I have hope to become a doctor. / My hope is to become a doctor.
examples.note: When using "kibo" in English, it's better to use the English word "hope" for clarity.

level_frequency.frequency_google_ngram: Moderate (for the meaning of "hope"); Low (for the JEM module)

readability_explanation.text: The word "Kibo" is a Japanese word that means "hope." It can also refer to the Japanese Experiment Module on the International Space Station. The first meaning is more common in everyday conversation. The second meaning is more specialized and used in the context of space exploration.

example_sentences.sentence: どんな困難があっても、希望を捨ててはいけない。(Donna konnan ga atte mo, kibou o sutete wa ikenai.)
example_sentences.translation: No matter what difficulties you face, you must not give up hope.

example_sentences.sentence: きぼうモジュールは、宇宙での科学実験を可能にする。(Kibou mojuuru wa, uchuu de no kagaku jikken o kanou ni suru.)
example_sentences.translation: The Kibo module enables scientific experiments in space.
